sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
Consider the following system of linear equations:

2x + 3y + z = 10

4x – y + 2z = 5

3x + 2y – 3z = -2

Use Cramer's rule to find the values of x, y and z.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix, which we'll call D.

The coefficient matrix is:

| 2  3  1 |
| 4 -1  2 |
| 3  2 -3 |

D = 2((-1)(-3) - (2)(2)) - 3(4(-3) - (2)(3)) + 1(4(2) - (-1)(3))
D = 2(3 - 4) - 3(-12 - 6) + 1(8 + 3)
D = 2(-1) + 3(18) + 11
D = -2 + 54 + 11
D = 63

Now we need to find the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing the corresponding column with the constants from the right-hand side of the equations.

For x:

| 10  3  1 |
|  5 -1  2 |
| -2  2 -3 |

Dx = 10((-1)(-3) - (2)(2)) - 3(5(-3) - (2)(-2)) + 1(5(2) - (-1)(-2))
Dx = 10(3 - 4) - 3(-15 + 4) + 1(10 - 2)
Dx = 10(-1) + 3(11) + 8
Dx = -10 + 33 + 8
Dx = 31

For y:

| 2 10  1 |
| 4  5  2 |
| 3 -2 -3 |

Dy = 2(5(-3) - (2)(-2)) - 10(4(-3) - (2)(3)) + 1(4(-2) - (5)(3))
Dy = 2(-15 + 4) - 10(-12 - 6) + 1(-8 - 15)
Dy = 2(-11) + 10(18) - 23
Dy = -22 + 180 - 23
Dy = 135

For z:

| 2  3 10 |
| 4 -1  5 |
| 3  2 -2 |

Dz = 2((-1)(-2) - (5)(2)) - 3(4(-2) - (5)(3)) + 10(4(2) - (-1)(3))
Dz = 2(2 - 10) - 3(-8 - 15) + 10(8 + 3)
Dz = 2(-8) + 3(23) + 10(11)
Dz = -16 + 69 + 110
Dz = 163

Now we can find the values of x, y, and z:

x = Dx / D = 31 / 63
y = Dy / D = 135 / 63
z = Dz / D = 163 / 63

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 31/63
y = 135/63
z = 163/63
